KPK Segera Buka Hasil Kajian Defisit BPJS Kesehatan
05 Nov 2019, 22:13 by Denisa Tristianty


KPK Segera Buka Hasil Kajian Defisit BPJS Kesehatan

Jakarta, KBRN : Kenaikan iuran Jaminan Kesehatan Nasional (JKN) senilai seratus persen per 1 Januari 2020 masih mendapat penolakan banyak kalangan masyarakat.
Deputi Pencegahan Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) Pahala Nainggolan menyatakan tengah melakukan kajian terkait defisit BPJS Kesehatan.
“Sekarang lagi saya kaji nih. Sebentar lagi selesai, akan kami buka hasil kajian kami,” terang Pahala kepada RRI.co.id di Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Defisit Badan Penyelenggara Jaminan Sosial (BPJS) Kesehatan menjadi alasan pemerintah menaikkan iuran.
“Tapi, yang jelas itu enggak satu faktor (penyebab kenaikan iuran). Multi faktor. Jadi, jangan ngebayangin karena kenaikan iuran kurang, bukan itu saja,”ungkap dia.
Faktor lain, kata dia, juga terdapat dalam defisit BPJS Kesehatan yang saat ini masih dalam penyelesaian rangkaian kajian KPK. Hasil kajian KPK tentang defisit BPJS Kesehatan itu akan dibuka dalam waktu dekat.
“Nanti kami undang (Menteri Kesehatan periode 2019-2020) Pak Terawan. Nanti kan, Pak Terawan mau datang ke KPK, nah nanti sekaligus kami paparkan sekaligus sama dia menurut kami. Jadi, defisit ini karena a,b,c,d,” katanya. (ANTARA FOTO/Aditya Pradana Putra/aww)

KPK Immediately Opens the Results of the Health BPJS Deficit Study
05 Nov 2019, 22:13 by Denisa Tristianty


KPK Immediately Opens the Results of the Health BPJS Deficit Study

Jakarta, KBRN: Increase of one hundred percent National Health Insurance (JKN) contribution as of January 1, 2020, has still been rejected by many people.
Deputy for Prevention of Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) Pahala Nainggolan said that it was conducting a study related to the BPJS Health deficit.
"Now I will review it. Soon we will finish, we will open the results of our study, "Pahala explained to RRI.co.id in Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5/2019).
The deficit of the Social Security Organizing Agency (BPJS) Health is the reason for the government to increase fees.
"However, what is clear is not one factor (the cause of the increase in fees). Multi factors. So, don't imagine because the contribution increase is not enough, that's not all, "he said.
Another factor, he said, was also found in the BPJS Health deficit which is currently still in the completion of the KPK study series. The results of the KPK study on the BPJS Health deficit will be opened in the near future.
"Later we will invite (Minister of Health 2019-2020) Pak Terawan. Later, Mr. Terawan wants to come to the Corruption Eradication Commission, well, later we will explain at the same time with him, in our opinion. So, this deficit is due to a, b, c, d, "he said. (BETWEEN PHOTOS / Aditya Pradana Putra / aww)
